document.masterDocTitle: Oribatid mites (Acari: Oribatida) recorded from Ireland: Catalogue, historical records, species habitats and geographical distribution, combinations, variations and synonyms

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Oribatid mites (Acari: Oribatida) recorded from Ireland: Catalogue, historical records, species habitats and geographical distribution, combinations, variations and synonyms

subSubSection.paragraph:
·
Banksinoma lanceolata (Michael, 1885)
*

· Original name:
Nostapis lanceolata Michael, 1885
.
· In: New British Oribatidae . Journal of the Royal Microscopical Society. 5, 385.

Irish Reference/s and Habitat/s : Moss,
Sphagnum
and salt marsh ( Halbert 1915 ), agricultural grassland ( Curry (1969a , 1969b , 1973 , 1976; Valarasan 1971 ; Ganley 1976 ; Purvis 1978 , unpublished data); permanent pasture on peat ( Whelan 1986 ); pasture and
Iris bog
at seashore (Purvis 1982); soil from barley field ( Emmanuel 1977 ;
Emmanuel et al. 1985a
); fungal sporocarps (O’ Connell 1994 ; O’ Connell and Bolger 1997 ; unpublished data); lichen ( Seyd 1992 ); soil from Monterey pine, Western hemlock,
Picea abies
and Sitka spruce forests ( Heneghan 1994 ; McCarthy 2004; Arroyo and Bolger 2007 ; unpublished data); moss on soil in Sitka spruce forest ( Arroyo and Bolger 2007 ); rushes, grass, agricultural soils,
Plantago
sward, bracken, woodland and moss (Bolger In press); pastures, Sitka spruce and broadleaved forests (beech, mixed hawthorn and ash), arable field, corn and barley crops, and blanket bogs (rough grazing) (
Arroyo et al. 2009a
); Machair foredunes and fixed (stable) dunes and Machair grassland (Arroyo and Bolger 2011), soil and canopy moss in oak forests, soil and moss on soil in Sitka spruce forests and moss on soil in Scots pine forests (
Arroyo et al . 2012
, 2013b , 2013c ); raised bogs, mountain blanket bogs, Atlantic blanket bogs and fens (
Wisdom et al . 2011
).
Counties: Carlow , Cork , Donegal , Dublin , Galway , Kerry , Kildare , Kilkenny , Laois , Mayo , Offaly , Roscommon , Sligo , Tipperary , Waterford , Wexford and Wicklow .

·
Oribella pectinata (Michael, 1885)

· Original name:
Notaspis pectinata Michael, 1885
.
· In: British Oribatidae, Vols. I and II. Ray Soc., London. 656 pp.

· Synonyms:
Oribata distincta Karpelles, 1893
;
Xenillus limburgiensis Oudemans, 1912
;
Dameosoma crinitum Berlese, 1916
.

paragraph.materialsCitation: Irish Reference/s and Habitat/s : Grassland on peat ( Longworth 1973 ). Counties: Mayo .

subSubSection.paragraph:
·
Pantelozetes paolii (Oudemans, 1913)
*

· Original name:
Xenillus paolii Oudemans, 1913
.
· In: Acarologische Aanteekeningen, XLVII. Entomologische Berichten ( Amsterdam ), 3, 372–376.

· Historical combinations/variations:
Oribella paolii (Oudemans) Willmann, 1931
;
Pantelozetes

( Pantelozetes ) paolii (Oudemans) Subías, 2004
;
Oribella paoli
[sic], Curry, 1969.

· Synonyms:
Eremaeus pectinatus (Michael) sensu Oudemans, 1900
[misidentification];
Oribella paolii

paolii tuxeni
Fujikawa, 1979;
Amazoppia caucasica Djaparidze, 1986
.
Counties: Carlow , Donegal , Dublin , Galway , Kildare , Laois , Louth , Limerick , Monaghan , Offaly , Roscommon , Tipperary and Wexford .
